I debugged the application and found that in ShowSystemThreadsAction at line 102
the top stack frame of the current thread will assigned to the variable tos.
After that this frame should present to the user with a StructuredSelection. But
unfortunately the method getTopStackFrame can return null. This cause an
AssertionFailedException in the constructor of the StructuredSelection.
               
Code snippet from ShowSystemThreadsAction (line 102-103):
  tos = thread.getTopStackFrame();
  getStructuredViewer().setSelection(new StructuredSelection(tos));

It is necessary to check that the top stack frame is not null before the
StructuredSelction will be initialised?

The consequence of this exception is still an unhandeld event loop exception
which will already logged in the error log.

I'm sorry but i cannot provide a special test case yet because my plugin is not
yet public.
